body:
maybe consider use array syntax? its pretty tricky to detect which one gets removed with same name.

eg: `name="test[0]"`
If I use array syntax as you suggest, I can select all the radio buttons in the list at once which is not desired behavior.

> If I use array syntax as you suggest, I can select all the radio buttons in the list at once which is not desired behavior.

what do you mean by that? please supply a CSB

Code like this:
```html
<input type="radio" name="test[0]" value="0">
<input type="radio" name="test[1]" value="1">
<input type="radio" name="test[2]" value="2">
...
```

...will allow the user to select (check) all the inputs, like this:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7558984/72943837-60a43c00-3d77-11ea-8c96-018406f5c197.png)

But in the example, the inputs are like this:
```html
<input type="radio" name="test" value="0">
<input type="radio" name="test" value="1">
<input type="radio" name="test" value="2">
...
```

...which allows the user to select (check) only one input at the same time, like this:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7558984/72943974-dad4c080-3d77-11ea-8abc-875897666454.png)
Same issue here. I'm badly stuck because of this and can't go back from react-hook-form at this stage.

I don't have time to looking into this issue for now until bugs on my hands gets resolved (useFieldArray). If anyone can help would be nice, otherwise you will have to wait. I only can do so much at a time.
If someone have work around, feel free to submit a temp solution too.

@avtarnanrey i will take a look this right after the other bug, but at the same time i don't want to delay your project. feel free to use other lib for now to solve your problem. i will ping you once this issue is resolved.
please verify with this beta version: 4.6.3-beta.4
It is fixed. Thank you for your quick help @bluebill1049
Works for me as well, thank you @bluebill1049 !
